segment.source: How to Set Up a Named License Group
segment.target: How to Set Up a Named License Group

segment.source: How to Set Up a Named License Group
segment.target: How to Set Up a Named License Group

segment.source: How to Set Up a Named License Group
segment.target: How to Set Up a Named License Group

segment.source: You can use the following procedure in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console to set up a named license group.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console to set up a named license group.

segment.source: When you set up a named license group, you are giving specific users access to the selected application.
segment.target: When you set up a named license group, you are giving specific users access to the selected application.

segment.source: To set up a Named License Group
segment.target: To set up a Named License Group

segment.source: In the left pane of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, right-click the Application Licenses node.
segment.target: In the left pane of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, right-click the Application Licenses node.

segment.source: Select New Named License.
segment.target: Select New Named License.

segment.source: Enter a name in the Application License Group Name field.
segment.target: Enter a name in the Application License Group Name field.

segment.source: Enter a value (in minutes) in the License Expiration Warning field.
segment.target: Enter a value (in minutes) in the License Expiration Warning field.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Enter descriptive text in the License Description field.
segment.target: Enter descriptive text in the License Description field.

segment.source: Select the Enabled check box to enable the license.
segment.target: Select the Enabled check box to enable the license.

segment.source: Select the Expiration Date check box (if you want to set an expiration date), and enter the expiration date or use the calendar utility to select a date.
segment.target: Select the Expiration Date check box (if you want to set an expiration date), and enter the expiration date or use the calendar utility to select a date.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Use the Named License User Wizard to add, edit, or remove specific users from the license group.
segment.target: Use the Named License User Wizard to add, edit, or remove specific users from the license group.

segment.source: Click Finish.
segment.target: Click Finish.
